document.docAuthor: Ferla, Noeli Juarez, Johann, Liana, Klock, Crisna, Majolo, Fernanda & Botton, Marcos
document.masterDocTitle: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from vineyards in Rio Grande do Sul State, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Phytoseiid mites (Acari: Phytoseiidae) from vineyards in Rio Grande do Sul State, Brazil

heading.emphasis: Key to Phytoseiidae mites found in vineyards of the State of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil

paragraph.keyLead:
1 . Podonotal region of dorsal shield with four pairs of "lateral" setae:
j 3
,
z 2
,
z 4
and
s 4
.................... Amblyseiinae ... 2

- Podonotal region of dorsal shield with six pairs of "lateral" setae:
j 3
,
z 2
,
z 3
,
z 4
,
s 4
and
s 6
present...... Typhlodrominae ... 21

2 . Setae
j 6
2–3 times longer than distance between their bases; ventrianal shield with one pair of pre-anal setae................................................................................................
Phytoseiulus macropilis

- Setae
j 6
less than twice as long as distance between their bases; ventrianal shield with one, two or three pairs of pre-anal setae.................................................................................................... 3

3 . Ratio of setae
s 4
:
Z 1
<3.0:1.0; female ventrianal shield vase-shaped; setae
s 4
,
Z 4
and
Z 5
not greatly longer than other dorsolateral setae............................................................................................. 4

- Ratio of setae
s 4
:
Z 1
> 3.0:1.0; female ventrianal shield pentagonal or vase-shaped; setae
s 4
,
Z 4
and
Z 5
distinctly longer than other setae.......................................................................................... 13
4 . Legs I, II and III usually without macrosetae; macrosetae present only on leg IV.................................... 5

5 . Spermatheca with atrium forked for at least half its length at junction with major duct, atrium appearing thick-walled.........................................................................................
Neoseiulus transversus
- Spermatheca with atrium not deeply forked at junction with neither major duct, not appearing thick-walled.............. 6

7 . Most of the dorsal shield not reaching the basis of the next row...............................
Neoseiulus californicus
- Most dorsal shields setae long (around 40–60 µm) often reaching the base of the next row............................ 8

8 . Setae
s 4
,
Z 4
and
Z 5
length 50, 65 , 78 respectively; macrosetae present only on tarsus IV.............
Neoseiulus anonymus

- Setae
s 4
,
Z 4
and
Z 5
length 28, 46 , 64 respectively; macrosetae present only on genu, tibia and tarsus IV....
Neoseiulus fallacis

9 . Setae
JV 1
inserted well behind anterior margin of shield; peritreme short, extending forward beyond base of setae
z 2
(except
Euseius inouei
)...................................................................................... 10

- Setae
JV 1
inserted on or near margin of ventrianal shield; peritreme extending as far as base of setae
j 1
................ 12

10 . Dorsal shield mostly smooth with few striae at anterolateral region......................................
Euseius ho

11 . Setae
r 3
and
R 1
on dorsal shield; peritreme extending as far as the region between
z 2
and
z 4
............. ..
Euseius sibelius

- Setae
r 3
and
R 1
outside dorsal shield; peritreme extending as far as the region between
j 1
and
j 3 ....... Euseius inouei

12 . Dorsal shield with most setae serrated; setae
j 1
,
j 3
,
z 2
,
z 4
,
Z 1
,
Z 4
,
Z 5
,
s 4
,
S 2
and
r 3
considerably thickened.............................................................................................
Typhlodromalus marmoreus

- Dorsal shield with most setae smooth and tapered...........................................
Typhlodromalus aripo

14 . With an ectal strip on the peritrematal shield, extending along the exopodal shield and around it to the posterior end of coxa IV................................................................................................... 19
- Without ectal strip adjacent to peritrematal shield........................................................... 15

16 . Ventrianal shield vase-shaped, with distinct constriction behind seta
JV 3 ......................... Amblyseius herbicolus

17 . Setae
Z 4
and
Z 5
length 120 and 197 respectively.........................................
Amblyseius neochiapensis

18 . Spermatheca cervix saccular-fundibular, atrium bifid.......................................
Amblyseius operculatus

- Spermatheca cervix with bell-shaped, atrium nodular.............................................
Amblyseius vitis

19 . Without macrosetae on leg I, II and III; setae
JV 2
and
ZV 2
inserted in the normal position on the female ventrianal shield.........................................................................................
Arrenoseius gaucho

- With macrosetae on leg I, II and III; setae
JV 2
and
ZV 2
inserted on anterior one-third of the pre-anal area of the female ventri- anal shield.......................................................................................... 20

20 . With a pair of metapodal plates on each side, movable digit of chelicera with three teeth............
Iphiseiodes saopaulus

- With a single metapodal plate on each side, movable digit of chelicera with two teeth.............
Iphiseiodes metapodalis

22 . Setae on dorsal shield short, smooth, not knobbed...........................................
Typhlodromus ornatus

- Setae on dorsal shield long strongly serrated and knobbed..............................
Typhlodromus transvaalensis

24 . Setae along margins of dorsal shield long, seta
R 1
much shorter than
s 6
; setae
S 5
and
Z 5
approximately equal in length; inser- tions of
JV 1
,
JV 3
and
ZV 2
aligned in nearly vertical rows on ventrianal shield; legs without macrosetae.....................................................................................................
Typhlodromina tropica

- Setae along margins of dorsal shield medium in length;
R 1
and
s 6
setae subequal in length, setae
S 5
usually much shorter than
Z 5
; insertions of
JV 1
,
JV 3
and
ZV 2
forming a triangle on ventrianal shield, leg IV with 0 to 3 macrosetae............... 25

25 . Seta
R 1
inserted on dorsal shield........................................................
Metaseiulus mexicanus

26 . Chaetotactic formula of genu II: 2, 2 / 1, 2 / 0, 1 ................................................
Metaseiulus cornus

- Chaetotactic formula of genu II: 2, 2 / 0, 2 / 0, 1 ..............................................
Metaseiulus camelliae
